intro: Thlaspi samolifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in clusters. This species is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine and arctic regions. It is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, including cold temperatures and poor soil nutrients. Thlaspi samolifolium plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
